channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Durbin calls on DOJ to investigate anonymous pizza deliveries to judges' homes
item.description: Sen. Dick Durbin, D-Ill., called on the Justice Department and the FBI to open investigations into mysterious pizza deliveries sent to judges' homes.

item.title: Statehouse Republicans Work With Democrats To Make Florida Purple Again
item.description: The establishment’s revival in Florida threatens Republican victories in the state long-term and Florida’s policy leadership across the country.

item.title: Trump plans to announce that the U.S. will call the Persian Gulf the Arabian Gulf, officials say
item.description: President Trump plans to announce, while on his trip to Saudi Arabia next week, that the United States will now refer to the Persian Gulf as the Arabi...

item.title: National Park Service Sued For Choosing Wealthy Environmentalists Over Small Farmers
item.description: Congress has opened an investigation into a settlement between NPS and environmental groups that booted ranchers from California land.

item.title: The Next Pope Must Be A Moral Voice In An Immoral World
item.description: The next pope will not change the faith, but he will shape how confidently the church lives it.

item.title: Trump’s Energy Revolution Is Great. It’s Also Fragile
item.description: Here are the steps the Trump administration can take to return power to the people and enshrine a better way to effectively care for the planet.

item.title: Idles Says ‘The Kids Are Not Alright’
item.description: The pop band of the moment vents our stress.

item.title: Pence’s profile, &c.
item.description: On Mike Pence and courage; the attorney general and prisons; a pope’s tombstone; a racy painting; and more.

item.title: New travel rules, same confusion: 'REAL ID' raises questions, concerns among college-aged travelers

item.title: Treasury secretary, U.S. trade rep to talk trade with Chinese in Switzerland

item.title: The Pulitzer Prize Remains A Crown For Left-Wing Propagandists
item.description: 'Once you realize Pulitzers are awarded for propaganda, it’s kind of funny to see who wins and who loses." -The Federalist's Mollie Hemingway.

item.title: Vance says Russia's demands are too high, but there's still a path to 'durable peace' with Ukraine
item.description: Vice President JD Vance said he believed that 'durable peace' could happen if Russia and Ukraine agree to terms to end conflict.

item.title: Colorado Postal Worker Pleads Guilty To Fraudulently Casting Multiple Mail Ballots In 2024 Election
item.description: Wanted to "test" the electronic voting signature verification system by taking ballots, forging voter signatures.

item.title: Scott Bessent’s Failed Attempt at Coherent Economic Policy
item.description: The Treasury secretary’s rationalization for Trump’s whims wouldn’t pass an undergrad econ exam.

item.title: Why No One Can Win an Argument with Donald Trump
item.description: Self-assurance carries the day.
